\title{simrel Documentation}
\date{Oct 13, 2019}
\release{0.5.5}
\author{Raju Rimal}
\newcommand{\sphinxlogo}{\vbox{}}
\renewcommand{\releasename}{Release}

\pagestyle{empty}

\pagestyle{plain}
\sphinxtableofcontents
\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


PySimrel package provides a way to simuilate data from a linear model. It provides few sets of parameters that users can specify to simulate the data. With these few sets of parameters, user can get wide range of properties in the simulated data.


\chapter{Contents:}
\label{\detokenize{index:contents}}

\section{Modules}
\label{\detokenize{Modules:module-pysimrel}}\label{\detokenize{Modules:modules}}\label{\detokenize{Modules::doc}}\index{pysimrel (module)@\spxentry{pysimrel}\spxextra{module}}
Simrel is a package for simulating linear model data


\section{Classes}
\label{\detokenize{Classes:classes}}\label{\detokenize{Classes::doc}}

\subsection{Simrel Class}
\label{\detokenize{Classes:simrel-class}}\index{Simrel (class in pysimrel)@\spxentry{Simrel}\spxextra{class in pysimrel}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Classes:pysimrel.Simrel}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Simrel}}}{\emph{n\_pred: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = 10}, \emph{n\_relpred: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = '4}, \emph{5'}, \emph{pos\_relcomp: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = '0}, \emph{1; 2}, \emph{3}, \emph{4'}, \emph{gamma: float = 0.7}, \emph{rsq: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = '0.7}, \emph{0.8'}, \emph{n\_resp: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = 4}, \emph{eta: float = 0.7}, \emph{pos\_resp: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = '0}, \emph{2; 1}, \emph{3'}, \emph{mu\_x: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = None}, \emph{mu\_y: Union{[}str}, \emph{int{]} = None}, \emph{parameter\_parsed: bool = False}, \emph{properties\_computed: bool = False}}{}
Main Class for simulated objects

The class contains all the definitions of \sphinxtitleref{simrel} objects. The class will also
provide necessary methods to compute various population properties.
\index{n\_pred (pysimrel.Simrel attribute)@\spxentry{n\_pred}\spxextra{pysimrel.Simrel attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Classes:pysimrel.Simrel.n_pred}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{n\_pred}}}
Number of predictor variables. Ex: \sphinxtitleref{n\_pred: 10}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Type}] \leavevmode
Either integer or string

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{n\_relpred (pysimrel.Simrel attribute)@\spxentry{n\_relpred}\spxextra{pysimrel.Simrel attribute}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Classes:pysimrel.Simrel.n_relpred}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{n\_relpred}}}
Number of relevant predictor variables for each response components
In the case of single response model, the parameters refers to the
number of predictors relevant for that single response
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Type}] \leavevmode
Either integer or string

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{parse\_parameters() (pysimrel.Simrel method)@\spxentry{parse\_parameters()}\spxextra{pysimrel.Simrel method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Classes:pysimrel.Simrel.parse_parameters}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_parameters}}}{}{}
Parse the parameters passed during initialization
This method parse the parameters which are passed as string into
a nested list. It uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_parm()}} function where further
documentation can be found.

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}



\subsection{Helper Classes}
\label{\detokenize{Classes:helper-classes}}\index{Covariances (class in pysimrel)@\spxentry{Covariances}\spxextra{class in pysimrel}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Classes:pysimrel.Covariances}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Covariances}}}
Class defining various covariances of the simulated data

This provides a nice graphical output of covariances.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_ww}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Covariance matrix of latent components of response

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_zz}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Covariance matrix of latent components of predictors

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_zw}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Covariance matrix containing covariances between latent components of predictors and response

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_yy}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Covariance matrix of response

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_xx}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Covariance matrix of response

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{cov\_xy}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Covariance matrix containing covariances between predictors and response

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{Properties (class in pysimrel)@\spxentry{Properties}\spxextra{class in pysimrel}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Classes:pysimrel.Properties}}\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{Properties}}}
A data class for different properties of simulated object
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{eigen\_x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Eigenvalues corresponding to predictors

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{eigen\_y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Eigenvalues corresponding to responses

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{relevant\_predictors}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Position index of relevant predictors for each responses

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sigma\_latent}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Variance-Covariance matrix of latent components of predictors and Responses

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{sigma}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Variance-Covariance matrix of predictors and Responses

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{beta\_z}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Regression coefficient corresponding to the principal components of predictors

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{beta}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Regression coefficient corresponding to the predictor variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{beta0}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Regression Intercept

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rsq\_w}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Coefficient of determination for latent component of responses (Variation explained by latent components of predictors on latent components of response)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rsq}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Coefficient of determination for responses (Variation explained by predictors on response)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{minerror}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} True minimum model error

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rotation\_x}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray}}) \textendash{} Rotation Matrix (eigenvector matrix) corresponding to predictors

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rotation\_y}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.ndarray = None}}) \textendash{} Rotation Matrix (eigenvector matrix) corresponding to response

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{Data (class in pysimrel)@\spxentry{Data}\spxextra{class in pysimrel}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\section{Utilities Functions}
\label{\detokenize{Utilities:module-pysimrel.utilities}}\label{\detokenize{Utilities:utilities-functions}}\label{\detokenize{Utilities::doc}}\index{pysimrel.utilities (module)@\spxentry{pysimrel.utilities}\spxextra{module}}\index{get\_cov() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{get\_cov()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.get_cov}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_cov}}}{\emph{rel\_pos}, \emph{rsq}, \emph{kappa}, \emph{lmd}, \emph{random\_seed=None}}{}
Compute Covariances

Compute covariances at the position specified in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{rel\_pos}} recursively using the
function \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{sample\_cov}} satisfying the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{rsq}} and the eigen values in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kappa}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lmd}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rel\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} position of relevant components

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rsq}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list of coefficient of determination

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{kappa}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list of eigenvalues related to response variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lmd}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list of eigenvalues related to predictor variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{random\_seed}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} An integer for random state

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A matrix of dimension equals to the length of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{kappa}} by length of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lmd}} with     computed covariances at the position specified in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{rel\_pos}}.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
np.array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_eigen() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{get\_eigen()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.get_eigen}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_eigen}}}{\emph{rate}, \emph{nvar}, \emph{min\_value=0.0001}}{}
Compute eigen values using exponential decay function.
\begin{equation*}
\begin{split}\lambda_i = \text{exp}^{-\gamma(i-1)}\end{split}
\end{equation*}\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rate}} \textendash{} rate of exponential decay factor

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{nvar}} \textendash{} Number of variables (number of eigenvalues to compute)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{min\_value}} \textendash{} Lower limit for smallest eigenvalue

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A list of eigenvalues

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_relpred() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{get\_relpred()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.get_relpred}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_relpred}}}{\emph{n\_pred}, \emph{n\_relpred}, \emph{pos\_relcomp}, \emph{random\_state=None}}{}
Identify relevant predictors through sampling

Get relevant and irrelevant position of predictor variables. The irrelevant
components index are the one which are not in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pos\_relcomp}}. The number of extra components
are defined in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{n\_relpred}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_pred}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Number of predictor variables

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_relpred}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} List of number of predictors relevant for each response

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pos\_relcomp}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} List of List containing the position index of relevant components

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{random\_state}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} An integer for random state

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A dictionary with relevant and irrelevant position index of predictors

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
dict

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_rotate() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{get\_rotate()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.get_rotate}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_rotate}}}{\emph{mat}, \emph{pred\_pos}, \emph{random\_state=None}}{}
Fill up a block of matrix \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{mat}} based on position index in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pred\_pos}}.
The block will be an orthogonal rotation matrix.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{mat}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{np.array}}) \textendash{} A matrix possibly a square matrix as covariance

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pred\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list of position index for the block rotation

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{random\_state}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} An integer for random state to control randomness

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A matrix of same size as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{mat}} but filled with an orthogonal block

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
np.array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{get\_rotation() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{get\_rotation()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.get_rotation}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{get\_rotation}}}{\emph{rel\_irrel\_pred}}{}
Create orthogonal rotation matrix

Creates an orthogonal rotation matrix from dictionary of relevant and irrelevant
positions using \sphinxtitleref{get\_rotate} function.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rel\_irrel\_pred}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{dict}}) \textendash{} A dictionary of relevant and irrelevant position (possibly obtained from the function \sphinxtitleref{get\_relpred}.

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
An orthogonal rotation matrix

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
np.array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{parse\_param() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{parse\_param()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.parse_param}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{parse\_param}}}{\emph{parm: Union{[}str, int, None{]}}}{}
Parse the parameters from string to a nested list
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{parm}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{str}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} Either integer, float (in some cases) or mostly string

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
A nested list of parsed parameters

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{sample\_cov() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{sample\_cov()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.sample_cov}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sample\_cov}}}{\emph{lmd}, \emph{rsq}, \emph{pos}, \emph{kappa}, \emph{alpha\_}}{}
Compute covariance satisfying given parameters

Compute covariance from a sample of uniform distribution satisfying \sphinxtitleref{rsq}, a set of \sphinxtitleref{lmd} and \sphinxtitleref{kappa}
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{lmd}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{set}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A set of eigenvalue of predictors at position specified by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pos}}.

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rsq}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Coefficient of determination

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} Position index of in which covariance need to be non-zero

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{kappa}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} Eigenvalue corresponding to response (univariate) or response component (multivariate)

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{alpha}} \textendash{} A sample from univariate distribution between -1 and 1

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
An array of computed covariances of length equals to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lmd}}.

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
np.array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{sample\_extra\_pos() (in module pysimrel.utilities)@\spxentry{sample\_extra\_pos()}\spxextra{in module pysimrel.utilities}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Utilities:pysimrel.utilities.sample_extra_pos}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{pysimrel.utilities.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{sample\_extra\_pos}}}{\emph{rs}, \emph{n\_extra\_pos}, \emph{extra\_pos}, \emph{irrel\_pos}}{}
Sample Extra Position Required

Sample position index of extra relevant predictors from irrelevant predictors in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{irrel\_pos}}.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rs}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} A numpy RandomSeed object

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{n\_extra\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} An integer for number of extra position index to sample

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{extra\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list container for collecting extra relevant components

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{irrel\_pos}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} A list or set of irrelevant position indices

\end{itemize}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
a list of relevant and irrelevant position indices

\item[{Return type}] \leavevmode
list

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
